body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky.
At the August term 1864, of the Boyle Circuit Court, the undersigned was fined $20. for unlawful gaming.
Your petitioner represents that he is not a professional gamester, on the contrary he seldom indulges in this practice, and never except as an amusement and Among gentlemen

On the occasion which was reported and for which he was fined, he was engaged in play for amusement, for refreshments only, and not for money or gain, And does not feel therefore that He should be singled out from the thousands guilty to the Same extent and be made on example of, whilst others are permitted to escape. He asks that for this occasion the Governor will interpose his clemency by remitting the fine, and promises not again, during this administration at least, to ask for mercy
The undersigned, Citizens of Danville, know Mr Cloyd, believe his statements, and unite with him in the prayr of his petition

M T. Chasway
Ben Bell
W R Brice

Boyle Cir Ct
vs
L. W. Cloyd
$20 --
Remitd
3d Oct/64
